status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

components.data: Cut lung into 1cm x 1cm sections and ensure weight is ~0.2g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut lung into 1cm x 1cm sections and ensure weight is ~0.2g.

components.data: Transfer the piece of tissue to a 10cm petri dish and add ~250µl Digestion Medium to cover it.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the piece of tissue to a 10cm petri dish and add ~250µl Digestion Medium to cover it.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of CGAP Human Lung Dissociation

components.data: Using two scalpels, chop the piece inside the tube as finely as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using two scalpels, chop the piece inside the tube as finely as possible.

components.data: Add ~2ml of Digestion Media and transfer the mashed tissue to a 15ml falcon tube using a 5ml stripette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add ~2ml of Digestion Media and transfer the mashed tissue to a 15ml falcon tube using a 5ml stripette.

components.data: Wash the dish with 1ml of Digestion Medium, transferring it to the 15ml falcon tube with the tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the dish with 1ml of Digestion Medium, transferring it to the 15ml falcon tube with the tissue.

components.data: Transfer it to an incubator at 37°C for 1 hour on a rocker (tissue from lower left lobe should be left for 30 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer it to an incubator at 37°C for 1 hour on a rocker (tissue from lower left lobe should be left for 30 minutes).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of CGAP Human Lung Dissociation
source_data.annotation: Freeze the tissue samples at this stage
source_data.thread_text: Freeze the tissue samples at this stage
source_data.body: Freeze the tissue samples at this stage

source_data.protocol_name: CGAP Freezing Human Tissue in Isopentane
source_data.protocol_name_html: CGAP Freezing Human Tissue in Isopentane

versions.protocol_name: CGAP Freezing Human Tissue in Isopentane
versions.protocol_name_html: CGAP Freezing Human Tissue in Isopentane

components.data: Receive tissue and place on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Receive tissue and place on ice.

components.data: Place the container of isopentane on dry ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the container of isopentane on dry ice.

components.data: Place 1 pair of forceps with the end in the dry ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place 1 pair of forceps with the end in the dry ice.

components.data: Add lumps of dry ice into the isopentane to achieve the correct temperature -70°C for oesophagus, spleen, lung, liver and other organs (-40°C for striated muscle), monitoring with the -100°C  thermometer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add lumps of dry ice into the isopentane to achieve the correct temperature -70°C for oesophagus, spleen, lung, liver and other organs (-40°C for striated muscle), monitoring with the -100°C  thermometer.

components.data: Place labelled 15ml falcon tubes on dry ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place labelled 15ml falcon tubes on dry ice.

components.data: Using the room temperature forceps, place the first tissue sample to be frozen onto the petri dish.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using the room temperature forceps, place the first tissue sample to be frozen onto the petri dish.

components.data: Cut tissue into chunks for freezing (1 for bulk RNA, 1 for spatial transcriptomics, 1 for fresh dissociation if not taken already).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut tissue into chunks for freezing (1 for bulk RNA, 1 for spatial transcriptomics, 1 for fresh dissociation if not taken already).

components.data: Place each piece of tissue for freezing into a separate weighing boat
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place each piece of tissue for freezing into a separate weighing boat

components.data: Using the cold pair of forceps, firmly pick up one side of the weighing boat and carefully lower the tissue directly into the isopentane (taking care to ensure the tissue doesn’t float out of the weighing boat).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using the cold pair of forceps, firmly pick up one side of the weighing boat and carefully lower the tissue directly into the isopentane (taking care to ensure the tissue doesn’t float out of the weighing boat).

components.data: Hold the sample submerged in the isopentane for approximately 10-20 seconds (depending on the size of the sample) until there are no more bubbles produced from the tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hold the sample submerged in the isopentane for approximately 10-20 seconds (depending on the size of the sample) until there are no more bubbles produced from the tissue.

components.data: Drain as much of the isopentane off the weighing boat as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drain as much of the isopentane off the weighing boat as possible.

components.data: Using the cold forceps, place each piece of tissue into the correspondingly labelled 15ml falcon tubes and keep on dry ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using the cold forceps, place each piece of tissue into the correspondingly labelled 15ml falcon tubes and keep on dry ice.

components.data: Transfer the labelled 15ml falcon tubes into the -80°C freezer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the labelled 15ml falcon tubes into the -80°C freezer.

components.data: Take the Mr Frosty cryo-container out of the dry ice and leave the lid off in a fume cupboard and allow isopentane to evaporate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take the Mr Frosty cryo-container out of the dry ice and leave the lid off in a fume cupboard and allow isopentane to evaporate.

components.data:
Isopentane

20ml

ThermoFisher (10468030)

Forceps

2

ThermoFisher UK Ltd (15232290)

100mm Petri Dish

1

Corning (430591)

Scalpel

1

Swann-Morton Ltd (0507)

Labelled 15ml falcon tubes

3 (Per Tissue)

Falcon (352097)

Small plastic weighing boats

3 (Per Tissue)

Fisher Scientific (HEA1420AF)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Isopentane

20ml

ThermoFisher (10468030)

Forceps

2

ThermoFisher UK Ltd (15232290)

100mm Petri Dish

1

Corning (430591)

Scalpel

1

Swann-Morton Ltd (0507)

Labelled 15ml falcon tubes

3 (Per Tissue)

Falcon (352097)

Small plastic weighing boats

3 (Per Tissue)

Fisher Scientific (HEA1420AF)

components.data: Collect the sample and filter the cells through a 100µm nylon mesh filter into a 50ml falcon tube. Using the plunger of a syringe, repeatedly mash the filter and rinse with cold Complete Medium up to 25ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect the sample and filter the cells through a 100µm nylon mesh filter into a 50ml falcon tube. Using the plunger of a syringe, repeatedly mash the filter and rinse with cold Complete Medium up to 25ml.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 8 of CGAP Human Lung Dissociation

components.data: Spin down 360xg for 10 min at 4°C. Acceleration 4, break 2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down 360xg for 10 min at 4°C. Acceleration 4, break 2.

components.data: Very carefully discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Very carefully discard the supernatant.

components.data: Resuspend the cell pellet in 25ml of Complete Medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cell pellet in 25ml of Complete Medium.

components.data: Spin down 360xg for 10 min at 4°C. Acceleration 4, break 2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down 360xg for 10 min at 4°C. Acceleration 4, break 2.

components.data: Very carefully discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Very carefully discard the supernatant.

components.data: Add 1ml of 1x Red Blood Cell Lysis solution to your cell pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1ml of 1x Red Blood Cell Lysis solution to your cell pellet.

components.data: Incubate 5 min on ice with periodic agitation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate 5 min on ice with periodic agitation.

components.data: Add fresh cold PBS up to 10ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add fresh cold PBS up to 10ml.

components.data: Spin down 360xg for 5 min at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down 360xg for 5 min at 4°C.

components.data: Discard supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant.

components.data: Resuspend pellet in 1ml of 0.04% BSA and count cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellet in 1ml of 0.04% BSA and count cells.

components.data:
If percentage of live cells is higher than 70-80%, cells can then be processed for scRNA-seq.

 

If percentage of live cells is below 70-80%, remove dead cells by following “MACS Live Dead Separation”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
If percentage of live cells is higher than 70-80%, cells can then be processed for scRNA-seq.

 

If percentage of live cells is below 70-80%, remove dead cells by following “MACS Live Dead Separation”.

source_data.status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
A single-cell suspension should have been prepared previously and cells number and viability assessed using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.

  • A viability percentage below 70-80% usually justifies using this Dead Cell Removal protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
A single-cell suspension should have been prepared previously and cells number and viability assessed using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.

  • A viability percentage below 70-80% usually justifies using this Dead Cell Removal protocol.

components.data:
Remove required number of cells and place in a 15ml Falcon Tube.

  • Required number of cells/total cells = volume required (ml).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove required number of cells and place in a 15ml Falcon Tube.

  • Required number of cells/total cells = volume required (ml).

components.data: Prepare 20ml 1X Binding Buffer by adding 1ml 20X Binding Buffer Stock to 19ml Nuclease Free Water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 20ml 1X Binding Buffer by adding 1ml 20X Binding Buffer Stock to 19ml Nuclease Free Water.

components.data: Centrifuge cell suspension for 5min at 300g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge cell suspension for 5min at 300g.

components.data: Remove supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove supernatant.

components.data: Resuspend cell pellet in 100ul Dead Cell Removal MicroBeads per 107 cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend cell pellet in 100ul Dead Cell Removal MicroBeads per 107 cells.

components.data: Mix well and incubate for 15mins at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well and incubate for 15mins at room temperature.

components.data: When 5min of incubation remains, place MS column (if <2x108 cells) or an LS column (if <2x109 cells) on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator and run 500µl (MS column) or 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer through the LS column, using a waste 15ml Falcon Tube to catch the effluent.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When 5min of incubation remains, place MS column (if <2x108 cells) or an LS column (if <2x109 cells) on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator and run 500µl (MS column) or 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer through the LS column, using a waste 15ml Falcon Tube to catch the effluent.

components.data: When incubation is finished, add 1ml (MS column) or 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer to cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When incubation is finished, add 1ml (MS column) or 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer to cells.

components.data: Run cell suspension through LS column on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator, using a 15ml Falcon Tube to catch effluent as the the live cell fraction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run cell suspension through LS column on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator, using a 15ml Falcon Tube to catch effluent as the the live cell fraction.

components.data: When cells have passed through, run 4 x 500µl (MS column) or 4 x 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer through LS column on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator using the same falcon tube to catch effluent as the the live cell fraction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When cells have passed through, run 4 x 500µl (MS column) or 4 x 3ml (LS column) 1X Binding Buffer through LS column on QuadroMACS Magnetic Cell Separator using the same falcon tube to catch effluent as the the live cell fraction.

components.data: Centrifuge cells at 500g for 5 min at 4°C.  Resuspend in 0.5-1ml PBS + 0.04% BSA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge cells at 500g for 5 min at 4°C.  Resuspend in 0.5-1ml PBS + 0.04% BSA.

components.data: Count cells and viability using nucleocounter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Count cells and viability using nucleocounter.

components.data: Resuspend in appropriate volume of 0.04% BSA in PBS to run in Chromium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend in appropriate volume of 0.04% BSA in PBS to run in Chromium.

components.data: Dilute cells to 2x106 cell per ml in 0.04% BSA and proceed to 10X Preparation for scRNA sequencing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute cells to 2x106 cell per ml in 0.04% BSA and proceed to 10X Preparation for scRNA sequencing.

components.data: Ensure all unused tissue, equipment and tubes that have been in contact with primary tissue are placed into Virkon in sweetie jar for a minimum of 1 hour. After this time aspirate and disposing in relevant sharps or waste routes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ensure all unused tissue, equipment and tubes that have been in contact with primary tissue are placed into Virkon in sweetie jar for a minimum of 1 hour. After this time aspirate and disposing in relevant sharps or waste routes.
